units.title: Crypt isolation and initial organoid culture
units.text: Crypt isolation was performed as previously reported45 with modifications. Briefly, tissues were washed with DPBS to remove debris. The tissues were treated with 2.5 mM EDTA at 4 °C for 40 minutes to release crypts. The supernatant containing crypts was collected and embedded in Cultrex RGF BME (R&D Systems) droplets in 48-well plates (~50 crypts/well). After solidification, droplets were overlaid with culture medium containing 10 μM Y-27632 (TargetMol). The medium was changed every 3 days.
units.rationale: Describes the stepwise isolation of crypts and their embedding for organoid initiation.

units.title: Generation of LGR5‑mNeonGreen reporter organoids
units.text: Two LGR5-targeting sgRNAs were cloned into SpCas9-equipped HP180 plasmids (a gift from Hui Yang lab), generating LGR5 sgRNA plasmids and HDR template were co-electroporated into human intestinal organoids using a NEPA21 electroporator (Nepa Gene) following published methods45. Organoid colonies derived from single cells were manually picked, expanded, and genotyped. To interfere with MBD3 expression, sgRNA sequences targeting MBD3 were cloned into SpCas9-equipped HP180 plasmids and electroporated into established LGR5-mNeonGreen reporter cells. Colonies from single cells were manually picked, expanded, and screened by Western blotting using an MBD3 antibody (1:200, Santa Cruz).
units.rationale: Provides the CRISPR‑based workflow for creating fluorescent reporter organoids.

units.title: Differentiation to Paneth cells
units.text: Organoids were induced to differentiate by directly changing the culture media to differentiation media. The differentiation protocols are as follows: Paneth cells. EGF (50 ng/mL), IGF‑I (100 ng/mL), FGF‑2 (50 ng/mL), DMH1 (2 μM), R‑spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83‑01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM), pVc (100 μg/mL) and IL‑22 (2 ng/mL). Culture for 3 days.
units.rationale: Specifies the cocktail and duration for inducing Paneth cell fate.

units.title: Differentiation to Goblet cells
units.text: Goblet cells. SJ000291942 (10 μM), R‑spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83‑01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM) and DAPT (10 μM) for 2 days and then replace CHIR with IWR‑1 (2 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Outlines the sequential small‑molecule treatment to generate Goblet cells.

units.title: Differentiation to Enteroendocrine cells
units.text: Enteroendocrine cells. DMH1 (2 μM), R‑spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83‑01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM) and CP673451 (0.5 μM) for 2 days, and then DMH1 (2 μM), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83‑01 (0.5 μM), DAPT (10 μM), CP673451 (0.5 μM) and Gefitinib (5 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Details the two‑phase media regimen for enteroendocrine differentiation.

units.title: Differentiation to Enterocytes
units.text: Enterocytes. EGF (50 ng/mL), IGF‑I (100 ng/mL), FGF‑2 (50 ng/mL), SJ000291942 (10 μM), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83‑01 (0.5 μM), IWR‑1 (2 μM) and VPA (0.75 mM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Lists the factors used to drive enterocyte maturation.

units.title: Induction of M cells
units.text: M cells. TNF‑α (50 ng/mL) treated for the first 4 hours and RANKL (100 ng/mL) for total 3 days.
units.rationale: Provides the cytokine treatment schedule to generate M cells.

units.title: EdU proliferation assay in organoids
units.text: Organoid culture medium was supplemented with 10 µM EdU (ethynyl‑2’-deoxyuridine, Beyotime) and incubated for 1 hour.
units.rationale: Describes the labeling step for measuring cell proliferation.

units.title: Re‑embedding of dissociated organoid cells
units.text: Organoids were dissociated into single cells with TrypLE (Gibco) and re‑embedded in fresh BME at a density of approximately 8000 cells per well, in a total volume of 20 μL, within a 48‑well plate.
units.rationale: Specifies the cell dissociation and re‑plating conditions for downstream assays.
